description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a). Physical description: 17 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. The text is vocalized. Final yāʼ dotted. Red dot text-stops. Dark cream paper, glossy, with laid lines and chain lines in groups of three visible ; frame-ruled. Title on tail of text block. Chiefly quinions. Catchword on the verso of each leaf. Origin: According to colophon, copied by Maḥmūd Ibn Muḥammad Ibn Muḥammad ibn Makīh al-Shāfiʻī, Thursday, end of ("munsalakh") Shawwāl 921 [Dec. 1515] (fol. 46a, "ʻām"). Incipit: بسم ... وبه ثقتي نحمدك اللهم على نعم يؤذن الحمد بازديادها ... وعلى اله وصحبه ما قامت الطروس والسطور Explicit: والصالحين و حسن اؤلئك وفيقا قال مصنفه رحمة الله عليه كان تمام بياضه فى آخريات ليلة حادي عشر ذي الحجة سنة ستين وسبعا بمنزلي بالدهيشه من ارض النيرب ظاهر دمشق المحروسه
author: Subkī, Tāj al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn ʻAlī, approximately 1327-1370
abstract: Careful copy of a treatise on uṣūl al-fiqh. According to the end of the text, the work was completed on 11 Dhū al-Ḥijjah 760 [Nov. 3, 1359] (fol. 46a).
extent: 49 leaves : paper ; 182 x 135 (115 x 95) mm. bound to 188 x 140 mm.
title: Kitāb Jamʻ al-jawāmiʻ fī al-uṣūl al-qawāṭiʻ
provenance: Ownership statement in the name of ʻAlī al-Rāshidī al-Shāfiʻī on fol. 1a (with another erased statement). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: سبكي، تاج الدين عبد الوهاب بن علي
subject: Islamic law—Interpretation and construction—History—14th century—Sources
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
